metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23773 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: cmd/go in Go before 1.16.14 and 1.17.x before 1.17.7 can misinterpret branch names that falsely appear to be version tags. This can lead to incorrect access control if an actor is supposed to be able to create branches but not tags.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays.

criterions.comment: golang-1.10: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
